grants.description: This is the continuation of an existing project that aims to improve the quality of life for older and disabled people from the West Balkan Community in London by providing them with support to be independent, active and healthy. The project is primarily based in Brent, but will be open to all potential beneficiaries across London. The project will help users to integrate further into British society and will encourage, support and train beneficiaries to become volunteers and manage activities.

grants.description: This is a re-instatement of a previous project, based in North Tyneside, which aims to improve the quality and range of life chances for local disabled people, their carers and families. Users with a particular medical condition can socialise whilst sharing experiences and coping mechanisms, as well as gaining mutual support from self-help groups. The groups currently support people with tinnitus, deafness, aphasia, migraine or who are bipolar. Additional groups would be established as required.

grants.description: The project in Machynlleth aims to re-order St. Peters Church to provide a modern affordable meeting place suitable for a range of activities for current users and the wider community, benefitting 250 people over two years. The ground floor will include storage cupboards, disabled toilet facilities, an office and meeting room and an exhibition area. The renovation will incorporate disabled access in all areas including a platform lift for disabled access to the upper level.

grants.description: A project to provide vital support to help vulnerable older people living with HIV in London, Manchester , Brighton, Birmingham and Bristol to manage life changing events .The scheme has recruited a peer led volunteer support network for those dealing with life changing events such as bereavement, illness, financial difficulties, housing, discrimination and legal issues. It will further provide opportunities for mentoring training, volunteering and offer information and links to social activity groups.

grants.description: This new ten year project will develop a parent-led partnership of services for families to address the most disadvantaged parents and children in the identified Nottingham City wards. grants.description: This project, based in Barnstable, North Devon, aims to improve quality of life for disengaged and vulnerable adults by providing accessible needs-led support allowing them to become better integrated into the general community. These will be used to contact external agencies and providers of appropriate safe and secure housing.

grants.title: 'Bridging The Gap' (BTG)

grants.description: This expanding project aims to reduce isolation experienced by Gosport's older community who face loneliness and disadvantage by providing support services. These include a local newsletter, befriending sessions and volunteer-led services such as gardening and home repair assistance. These are free for service users and will enable them to continue to live independently. Social meeting groups will be introduced and an advocacy service will provide guidance on difficult or stressful issues.
